Challenging repertoire includes music from Renaissance to Contemporary and all things in between. The group is trained to perform without a conductor. In addition to participating in the fall and spring concerts at the university, the ensemble pursues its mission to bring music to the community by performing at local public and private schools, such as the George Jackson Academy, and hospitals and senior centers including the Hallmark Senior Residence in Battery Park City. Madrigal Singers also takes its program to organizations such as the Salmagundi Arts Club and others dedicated to supporting the arts. The ensemble is involved in the revitalization of the NYU Choral Alumni and last year at the Memorial/Dedication of the plaque for Marian Konstan, they performed in the choral suite at the Kimmel Center. The New York University Madrigal Singers performed at the 29th Annual Conference of the International Society of Music Education held in Beijing, China in August of 2010. In spring of 2011, the ensemble did a combined concert with the Yale University Madrigal singers, and last January, together with the NYU Jazz Choir, traveled to the middle east to perform 9 concerts at United Arab Emirates University, The University at Sharjah and NYU Abu Dhabi. In the Spring of 2013, they performed at St. Joseph’s Church in Greenwich Village, with Nassim Al Saba, the choir from the American University of Sharjah.    Please visit us at www.youtube.com/NYUMadrigalSingers. Courses can be taken for zero to one credit. All rehearsals are in the Education Building, 35 West 4th St.    NYU Chorale (meets Weds. 7 - 8:30pm) NYU Chorale is the largest classical choral ensemble at New York University. For 130 years, it has served the entire NYU community performing major works from the choral/orchestral repertoire. The NYU Chorale offers singers an in-depth performance experience of large-scale choral works with special emphasis on works from the 19th and 20th centuries.    University Singers A classically oriented choir, this ensemble is devoted to chamber repertoire from all periods. Enrollment is limited to 32 singers. The audition process includes performance of a solo song, language proficiency, tonal memory and sight-reading.    Women’s Choir (meets Tues. 7 - 8:30pm) An ensemble of 60 voices devoted to the highest quality literature in a wide variety of musical styles. Auditions consist of a solo song, vocalization and tonal memory exercises.    Jazz Choir (Vocal Jazz Ensemble) (meets Mon. & Thurs. 6:45 - 8:15pm) Watch a performance here . An ensemble of 20 vocalists. Repertoire is of high quality and is chosen to represent a wide range of jazz/contemporary periods and styles. Auditions consist of a solo song, improvisation to a 24 measure blues chorus, and sight-reading.    Madrigal Singers (meets Mon. 6:45 - 8:45pm) Madrigal Singers is a small, coed ensemble of 12-16 singers dedicated to the joy of a capella singing. Challenging repertoire includes music from Renaissance to Rock and all things in between. The audition process consists of performance of a solo song, tonal memory and sightreading. Contact Nancy Shankman for more details.    Men's Glee Club (meets Tues. 7 - 8:30pm) The NYU Men's Glee Club has been dormant for a while now, but it has been revived this fall. We are looking for any type of student who is looking to sing, make friends, and perform. Contact nyumensglee@gmail.com for more information. Click here to visit the Men's Glee Club website.    To learn more about the NYU Alumni Choir, visit nyualumnichoir.com  To find out more about the Madrigal Singers and Jazz Choir in Abu Dhabi , click here . Courses can be taken for zero to one credit. All rehearsals are in the Education Building, 35 West 4th St.    NYU Chorale (meets Weds. 7 - 8:30pm) NYU Chorale is the largest classical choral ensemble at New York University. For 130 years, it has served the entire NYU community performing major works from the choral/orchestral repertoire. The NYU Chorale offers singers an in-depth performance experience of large-scale choral works with special emphasis on works from the 19th and 20th centuries.    University Singers A classically oriented choir, this ensemble is devoted to chamber repertoire from all periods. Enrollment is limited to 32 singers. The audition process includes performance of a solo song, language proficiency, tonal memory and sight-reading.    Women’s Choir (meets Tues. 7 - 8:30pm) An ensemble of 60 voices devoted to the highest quality literature in a wide variety of musical styles. Auditions consist of a solo song, vocalization and tonal memory exercises.    Jazz Choir (Vocal Jazz Ensemble) (meets Mon. & Thurs. 6:45 - 8:15pm) Watch a performance here . An ensemble of 20 vocalists. Repertoire is of high quality and is chosen to represent a wide range of jazz/contemporary periods and styles. Auditions consist of a solo song, improvisation to a 24 measure blues chorus, and sight-reading.    Madrigal Singers (meets Mon. 6:45 - 8:45pm) Madrigal Singers is a small, coed ensemble of 12-16 singers dedicated to the joy of a capella singing. Challenging repertoire includes music from Renaissance to Rock and all things in between. The audition process consists of performance of a solo song, tonal memory and sightreading. Contact Nancy Shankman for more details.    Men's Glee Club (meets Tues. 7 - 8:30pm) The NYU Men's Glee Club has been dormant for a while now, but it has been revived this fall. We are looking for any type of student who is looking to sing, make friends, and perform. Contact nyumensglee@gmail.com for more information. Click here to visit the Men's Glee Club website. Challenging repertoire includes music from Renaissance to Contemporary and all things in between. The group is trained to perform without a conductor. In addition to participating in the fall and spring concerts at the university, the ensemble pursues its mission to bring music to the community by performing at local public and private schools, such as the George Jackson Academy, and hospitals and senior centers including the Hallmark Senior Residence in Battery Park City. Madrigal Singers also takes its program to organizations such as the Salmagundi Arts Club and others dedicated to supporting the arts. The ensemble is involved in the revitalization of the NYU Choral Alumni and last year at the Memorial/Dedication of the plaque for Marian Konstan, they performed in the choral suite at the Kimmel Center. The New York University Madrigal Singers performed at the 29th Annual Conference of the International Society of Music Education held in Beijing, China in August of 2010. In spring of 2011, the ensemble did a combined concert with the Yale University Madrigal singers, and last January, together with the NYU Jazz Choir, traveled to the middle east to perform 9 concerts at United Arab Emirates University, The University at Sharjah and NYU Abu Dhabi. In the Spring of 2013, they performed at St. Joseph’s Church in Greenwich Village, with Nassim Al Saba, the choir from the American University of Sharjah.
